description: Adds an object to a bucket.
mitreAttackSubTechniques: T1565.001 - Data Manipulation: Stored Data Manipulation

unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: The PutObject API call can be used to store objects in S3 as a staging area for data that might be collected or processed before exfiltration or further use.
Attackers can use PutObject to overwrite existing objects with benign data or to modify metadata, helping to conceal malicious activity by removing indicators of compromise within cloud storage.
The PutObject API can be used to transfer tools or malicious binaries into an S3 bucket, facilitating their retrieval and execution elsewhere in the environment.
Attackers could upload objects with names or metadata that mimic legitimate files using the PutObject API, making malicious content harder to detect.
The PutObject API could be used to overwrite critical objects, leading to data loss or destruction, particularly if previous versions are not preserved.
Attackers can use PutObject to upload files containing hidden or obfuscated data (e.g., within images), supporting defense evasion.
Objects added to an S3 bucket via PutObject can be used to transfer tools or payloads across different cloud environments, supporting lateral movement within compromised infrastructure.

incidents.description: Incident Report: TaskRouter JS SDK Security Incident - July 19, 2020
LA Times homicide website throttles cryptojacking attack

securityImplications: Attackers might use PutObject to upload malicious content or overwrite existing files in S3 buckets.
